meanings.definition: Tearfully or weakly emotional; foolishly sentimental.
meanings.sent1: She became maudlin after watching a sad movie.
meanings.sent2: He often gets maudlin when he hears old love songs.
meanings.sent3: The maudlin puppy cried at the smallest noise.
meanings.sent4: Her maudlin outburst was like a storm of tears.
meanings.sent5: The maudlin farewell scene left everyone in tears.

meanings.definition: Drunk enough to be emotionally silly.
meanings.sent1: After a few drinks, he became maudlin and started hugging everyone.
meanings.sent2: She tends to get maudlin at parties when she's had too much to drink.
meanings.sent3: The maudlin group of friends laughed uncontrollably at a simple joke.
meanings.sent4: His maudlin behavior at the party was both amusing and embarrassing.
meanings.sent5: The maudlin revelry continued late into the night.
